# nxos_features (Resource)

This resource can manage the feature configuration.

- API Documentation: [fmEntity](https://pubhub.devnetcloud.com/media/dme-docs-10-5-3/docs/Feature%20Management/fm:Entity/)

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "nxos_features" "example" {
  bash_shell     = "enabled"
  bfd            = "enabled"
  bgp            = "enabled"
  dhcp           = "enabled"
  evpn           = "enabled"
  hmm            = "enabled"
  hsrp           = "enabled"
  interface_vlan = "enabled"
  isis           = "enabled"
  lacp           = "enabled"
  lldp           = "enabled"
  macsec         = "enabled"
  netflow        = "enabled"
  ngmvpn         = "enabled"
  ngoam          = "enabled"
  nv_overlay     = "enabled"
  ospf           = "enabled"
  ospfv3         = "enabled"
  pim            = "enabled"
  ptp            = "enabled"
  pvlan          = "enabled"
  sflow          = "enabled"
  ssh            = "enabled"
  tacacs         = "enabled"
  telnet         = "enabled"
  udld           = "enabled"
  vn_segment     = "enabled"
  vpc            = "enabled"
}
```

## Schema

### Optional

- `bash_shell` (String) Administrative state.
  - Choices: `enabled`, `disabled`
- `bfd` (String) Administrative state.
  - Choices: `enabled`, `disabled`
- `bgp` (String) Administrative state.
  - Choices: `enabled`, `disabled`
- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.
- `dhcp` (String) Administrative state.
  - Choices: `enabled`, `disabled`

  - Choices: `enabled`, `disabled`

  - Choices: `enabled`, `disabled`

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The distinguished name of the object.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

In Terraform v1.12.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `identity` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = nxos_features.example
  identity = {
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
### Identity Schema


#### Optional

- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.

In Terraform v1.5.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `id` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = nxos_features.example
  id = ""
}
```

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import nxos_features.example ""
```
